clinical_study.brief_title: A Case-control Study to Assess the Association Between Facial Characteristics and Coronary Artery Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: A Case-control Study to Assess the Association Between Facial Characteristics and Coronary Artery Diseases

lead_sponsor.agency: China National Center for Cardiovascular Diseases

clinical_study.source: China National Center for Cardiovascular Diseases

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore the facial characteristics asscosiated with the increased risk of coronary artery diseases. The secondary purpose is to evaluate the diagnostic efficacy of appearance factors for coronary artery diseases.

detailed_description.textblock:
Several age-related appearance factors were described associated with increased risk of coronary artery diseases (CAD). However, several limitations made these facial risk factors hard to be utilized in clinical practice, including 1) low prevalence in CAD patients, 2) lack of specific definition, 3) poor reproducibility in artificial recognition.
Thus, we designed a case-control study to explore new, common and well-defined facial characteristics associated with CAD and evaluate the diagnostic efficacy of appearence factors in CAD. We will recuit 100 patients with triple-vessel or left main diseases (3VD/LM group) and 400 patients without coronary lesion stenosis≥ 50% (No CAD group) judged by coronary computer tomography or coronary angiography. We will collect patients' baseline information and facial images. One hand, we will explore the facial factors associated with CAD by comparing the exposure rates of different facial factors in 3VD/LM group and No CAD group based on artificial intelligence technology. On the other hand, we will build a new CAD risk model by combining Framingham risk score and facial factors associated with CAD, and compare the diagnostic efficacy of the new model with Framingham risk score.

primary_outcome.measure: Assess the association between facial factors and increased risk of triple-vessel or left main artery diseases
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of enrollment (6 months)

arm_group.description: Patients enrolled with triple-vessel (3VD) or left main (LM) diseases judged by coronary computer tomography or coronary angiography will be assigned to 3VD/LM group.
Patients enrolled without coronary lesion stenosis≥ 50% judged by coronary computer tomography or coronary angiography will be assigned to coronary artery disease (CAD) group.

intervention.description: The exposures are facial characteristics which differ significantly in exposure rates between triple-vessel (3VD)/ left main (LM) diseases group and no coronary artery disease (CAD) group.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who undergo coronary computer tomography or coronary angiography finding triple-vessel, left main or no coronary artery diseases from both resident patients and outpatient.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Triple-vessel, left main or no coronary artery diseases diagnosed by coronary computer tomography or coronary angiography
- 50-70 years old
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI)
- Prior coronary artery bypass graft (CABG)
- Without blood biochemistry outcome
- With artificially facial alteration (i.e. cosmetic surgery, facial trauma or make-up)
- Other situations which make patients fail to be photographed
